comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:58.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/58.0
Build ID:20170926220106

Using mozregression tool, I found window to be:
Last good revision: 2387ada864282880d3a498d643abe3d8b887ee59 (2015-10-14)
First bad revision: e193b4da0a8c1025aa76a403c64663ff1cd41709 (2015-10-15)
Pushlog:
https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/pushloghtml?fromchange=2387ada864282880d3a498d643abe3d8b887ee59&tochange=e193b4da0a8c1025aa76a403c64663ff1cd41709

Further bisection fails with the message "Unable to find enough data to bisect".

I couldn't reproduce this issue on latest Beta 57.0b3 or latest Release Candidate 56.0, so my assumption is that this bug is only affecting Nightly channel.

Milan, by any chance, do you know a canvas specific preference that is enabled only in Nighly channels?
comments.author: roxana.leitan@softvision.ro

comments.text:
I can reproduce with the same regression range as in comment 5, on nightly only (since 2015).  Dev edition and beta are fine.  We should figure out what this is, but it is nightly only, so marking 57 disabled.

Not user agent related.
comments.author: milaninbugzilla@gmail.com

comments.text:
OK, there is nothing in the div for the "screen" in nightly, there is stuff in the other releases, so not likely to be graphics.  There are no console messages in nightly, where the versions that work start with the "Fonts loaded".

Jonathan, is there something different with font handling on nightly vs. other releases?
comments.author: milaninbugzilla@gmail.com

comments.text:
Sanitization/validation of downloadable fonts. It's using Roboto from Google Fonts, but the resources served aren't compliant with the OpenType spec, and so OTS rejects them; and apparently the site detects the failure in some way and gives up, rather than rendering with a fallback (as one would expect by default). Check the web console for errors during the page load.

We don't apply the same level of validation in Beta/Release builds, per bug 1244693.

I expect you can trigger a similar failure in release builds by disabling downloadable fonts (set gfx.downloadable_fonts.enabled = false).

Workaround for Nightly users is to set gfx.downloadable_fonts.otl_validation to false, but the proper solution is for Google Fonts to fix the resources they're serving. https://github.com/google/fonts/issues/738.
comments.author: jfkthame@gmail.com

comments.text: Sounds like we can tell the site to look for the fallback as well, while waiting for Google to fix the fonts issue.
comments.author: milaninbugzilla@gmail.com
